tuyoquotes.quote: Beside the coals of the dying fire, within the trampled borders of our abandoned camp, surrounded by the great forest of the winter country, I waited for a terrible death.
At last the warleader dismounted. He was far taller than I; even taller than most of his own people. He looked cruel to me, with a hard set to his mouth.
He said to that man, "We must have pressed them even harder than we knew, if they've left a tuyo for us."
I must have jerked in outrage, for he turned quickly to look at me again.
He tilted his head in surprise, perhaps at my words, or perhaps because I spoke darau at all.
_That_ drove everything else out of my mind. The shock was greater because I had just been thinking my brother and our people were safe. For a moment, I could not answer. Then I found my voice.
When my brother brought word of what had happened, my mother would not think of me sitting in an uncomfortable Lau chair in a twoo-warm Lau tent, eating too-spicy barley stew.

nikolesquotes.quote: Nikoles Iananâ€™s appetite for vengeance wavered and dimmed and finally wore itself out long before the execution was meant to end.

tarashanaquotes.quote: "This is not only bread," I said. "It means something. What does it mean?"
